items.title: Alberta premier says loss of measles elimination status concerning, urges vigilance
items.description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says Canada recently losing its measles elimination status is concerning, but her government might not have many other options on the table to help get it back.

items.title: ‘We’ve moved to Canada and are proud of it': Sour Puss liquor production moves from Minnesota to Quebec
items.description: The company has signed a deal to produce the liquor in Quebec after several provinces stopped stocking certain American-made alcohol products in response to U.S. trade actions.

items.title: Manitoba Government Adds $1 Million to Accelerate Construction of Park Community Centre and Child-Care Facility in Brandon
Latest case of animal abandonment in North Okanagan has advocates issuing a plea
items.description: While it's not known why exactly the chickens would be abandoned there, Runnalls said there are always other options to consider.

items.title: Manitoba Government Provides $750,000 to Support Victims of Crime
Calgary mayor proposes ban on raising other nations' flags at city hall
items.description: Farkas' urgent motion comes after a request to raise the State of Palestine’s flag outside Calgary city hall was approved back in September.

items.title: Manitoba Government Invests $100,000 to Replace Brandon University Observatory Dome
Manitoba Government Delivers on Promises to Make Communities Safer
On Our Radar: Buddie turns its completely understandable stress into something beautiful
items.description: Guitar bands are back in Vancouver, and it’s beautiful.

items.title: B.C. Attorney General 'deeply disturbed' by social media giant X's intimate image case
items.description: British Columbia's Attorney General says she's "deeply disturbed" that the social media company X has filed a legal challenge against an order to remove a non-consensual intimate image from the internet.

items.title: WATCH: Global Okanagan News at 5:30 p.m. – Nov. 14
items.description: Watch the online news edition of Global Okanagan at 5:30 p.m.

items.title: Fall drought could spell water troubles for central Alberta regions, expert says
items.description: Large swaths of Alberta are experiencing extreme drought conditions. Some farmers are thinking twice about the amount of water they use heading into the winter months.

items.title: How Ontario school boards decide when to cancel school buses
items.description: Many Ontario families will wake up this winter wondering if school busses are cancelled. But the decision to cancel them isn't as simple as you think.

items.title: ‘The Librarians’ Traces the Battle of a Lifetime
items.description: As rightward forces campaign to pull books from library shelves, a gripping new documentary exposes what’s at stake.

items.title: B.C. Lions quarterback Nathan Rourke named CFL's outstanding player, top Canadian
Paulatuk, N.W.T., wants to fix drafty homes as part of its net-zero goal
items.description: The Paulatuk Energy Working Group has a goal of becoming carbon neutral. But everyone – from residents to those leading the project – agree making sure homes don’t waste that energy is a critical part of the target.

items.title: New Brunswick mine added to major projects but opponents say it'll do more harm than good
items.description: In New Brunswick, opponents of a mining project that made Prime Minister Mark Carney's nation-building projects say the proposal could do more harm than good,

items.title: Between Breaths dives into the life of a Newfoundland conservationist who loved people as much as whales
items.description: "What is your life, and what is your life to you in its final moments?"
